deck: Kongregate, an open platform for web gaming, set forth on a massive effort to rebrand its identity and platform.
challenge: By utilizing web components it was possible to make design changes without breaking existing functionality, and to expand the new brand’s visual identity across all Kongregate products while maintaining a consistent look and feel.

roles.description:
Working closely with Kongregate’s Sr. Product Designer, we developed a new design system that could be used across all Kongregate products. This included a new color palette, typography, and a rich set of components that could be used to build new features and pages.

Our small team of developers used design tokens from Figma, and built web components using the Lit Framework. We also used Storybook to document and test the components, and an NX monorepo to manage the project. We integrated the new design system into the primary Kongregate Rails app, using Hotwire/Turbo, StimulusJS, View Components, and Lookbook.
roles.technologies: Figma, Lit Web Components, NX Monorepo, Storybook
Figma, Hotwire/Turbo, Ruby on Rails, StimulusJS, View Components, and Lookbook

deck: TED needed to develop an experience that reconnects educators and students with the joy and discovery of learning. For teachers, that meant using TED’s unique capacity to tell compelling stories as a teaching tool, and for students, giving them the opportunity to craft stories of their own.

awards: TED-Ed has won 8 Webby awards, TIME Magazine best site of the year award, and drawn millions of users.
